subject: Writing
title: Cicero: Rome's Greatest Orator
description: A micro-lesson that makes Cicero: Rome's Greatest Orator usable.

hook.text: Cicero's speeches were so powerful that after his death, Mark Antony had his hands and tongue nailed to the Forum.

buildup.text: Marcus Tullius Cicero rose from a modest family to become Rome's most celebrated lawyer and senator.

discovery.text: He developed the five canons of rhetoric: invention, arrangement, style, memory, and delivery.

twist.text: Cicero's Philippics â€” speeches attacking Mark Antony â€” were brilliant but cost him his life in 43 BC.

climax.text: His rhetorical framework became the basis of Western education for over 1,500 years.

punchline.text: Rome silenced its greatest speaker. His words outlived the empire.

quiz.question: How many canons of rhetoric did Cicero develop?
